ETN field definitions

Peter Desmet & Filip Waumans

2020-09-29

Source: vignettes/etn_fields.Rmd
etn_fields.Rmd

Field definitions are managed in the ETN database, not in this package, but suggestions/corrections can be reported as in issue (see the contributing guide).

Projects

Related function: get_projects().

field definition example data type
principal_investigator character
imis_dataset_id integer
moratorium boolean
longitude double
latitude double
end_date date
start_date date
pk integer
project_code character
project_type character
application_type character
telemetry_type character
project_name character
coordinating_organization character
principal_investigator_email character

Animals

Related function: get_animals().

field definition example data type
sedative Name of sedative used if applicable. as in: aquacalm character
age Weight of animal that carries tag, in units specified in â€˜Age unitsâ€™. format: integer; as in: 2 double
weight_unit Units of weight. as in: g character
weight Weight of animal that carries tag, in units specified in â€˜Weight unitsâ€™. format: double; as in: 806.9 double
length4_unit Units of quaternary length. as in: mm character
length4 Quaternary length measurement, depending on â€˜Length4 typeâ€™, in units specified in â€˜Length4 unitsâ€™. format: double; as in 46.73 double
length4_type Specify type of quaternary size measurement (e.g.Â width). format: free text; as in: pectoral fin length character
length3_unit Units of tertiary length. as in: mm character
length3 Tertiary length measurement, depending on â€˜Length3 typeâ€™, in units specified in â€˜Length3 unitsâ€™. format: double; as in: 7.23 double
length3_type Specify type of tertiary size measurement (e.g.Â width). format: free text; as in: vertical eye diameter character
length2_unit Units of secondary length. as in: mm character
length2 Secondary length measurement, depending on â€˜Length2 typeâ€™, in units specified in â€˜Length2 unitsâ€™. format: double; as in: 9.50 double
length2_type Specify type of secondary size measurement (e.g.Â width). format: free text; as in: horizontal eye diameter character
length1_unit Units of length. as in: cm character
length1 Length of animal that carries tag, depending on â€˜Length typeâ€™, in units specified in â€˜Length unitsâ€™. format: double; as in: 46.00 double
length1_type Specify type of length recorded (e.g.Â hood length, fork length, standard length, etc.). format: free text; as in: total length character
recapture_date_time If applicable, date of recapture of the tagged animal. format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ; as in: 2017-07-10T12:00:00Z datetime
release_longitude Longitude of release location. Note: in the western hemisphere all longitudes must be negative. format: ddd.ddddd; as in: 2.59020 double
release_latitude Latitude of release location. Note: in the southern hemisphere all latitudes must be negative. format: dd.ddddd; as in: 51.36324 double
release_location Name of release location. Please refer to a specific nearby point of land, town, island, or body of water that uniquely identifies this tagging location. as in: Reefballs C-Power character
release_date_time Date and time that tagged animal was released, in UTC. format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ; as in: 2016-04-04T12:30:00Z datetime
capture_temperature_change Difference between water temperature of the system where the fish was caught and the water temperature of the holding reservoir. units: degrees celsius; as in: 5ÂºC character
capture_depth Water depth at which the animal was caught. units: metres; format free text; as in: 25 m character
capture_method Name of the method and materials used to capture animal. format: free text; as in: line fishing character
capture_longitude Longitude of capture location. Leave blank if same as release location. Note: in the western hemisphere all longitudes must be negative. format: ddd.ddddd; as in: 2.59020 double
capture_latitude Latitude of capture location. Leave blank if same as release location. Note: in the southern hemisphere all latitudes must be negative. format: dd.ddddd; as in: 51.36324 double
capture_location Name of capture location. Please refer to a specific nearby point of land, town, island, or body of water that uniquely identifies this tagging location. Okay to leave blank if same as release location. format: free text; as in: Reefballs C-Power character
capture_date_time Date and time that animal was caught, in 24h UTC. Datetime fields should follow the ISO-8601 format. format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ; as in: 2017-06-27T12:00:00Z datetime
tagger Person conducting tagging as in: Pieterjan Verhelst character
animal_nickname character
animal_label Identification code that uniquely identifies each animal, as specified by the researcher. as in: A82 character
aphia_id Aphia Id format: integer; as in: 2 integer
common_name The speciesâ€™ common English name. as in: Atlantic cod character
scientific_name Scientific name of animal that carries the tag. as in: Gadus morhua character
tag_fk integer
tag_id Select a tag. A tag code space will only appear here after adding the tag metadata in the tab â€˜Tagsâ€™. as in: A69-9004-2210 character
animal_project_code character
integer
pk integer
dna_sample Indicates whether the animal that carries the acoustic tag is also sampled for DNA. format: y or n; as in: y character
tagging_methodology Describe method and materials used to attach tag to animal. as in: inserted into abdominal cavity through midventral line incision, closed using 2 polydioxanone monofilament sutures. character
tagging_type Indicates how tag was attached to animal (e.g. internal, external, oral, gastric, subcutaneous, etc.). as in: internal character
treatment_type Contains a designation of treatment group as appropriate for the particular study. Researchers will have to contact the authors directly for definitions. Try to make these as clear as possible (e.g.Â use Control instead of C, Lake release instead of Lake). format: free text; as in: Control character
surgery_longitude Longitude of surgery location. Note: in the western hemisphere all longitudes must be negative. format: dd.ddddd; as in: 2.59020 double
surgery_latitude Latitude of surgery location. Note: in the southern hemisphere all latitudes must be negative. format: dd.ddddd; as in: 51.36324 double
surgery_location Short name of surgery location (i.e.Â hatchery name). format: free text; as in: onboard RV character
surgery_date_time Date that surgery was conducted. Date fields should follow the ISO-8601 format. format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ; as in: 2017-06-27T12:00:00Z datetime
stock Water body of origin. Can enter unknown or not applicable. as in: Southern Bight character
wild_or_hatchery Origin of animal that carries the tag. Enter wild, hatchery or unknown. as in: wild character
life_stage Life stage of animal. This will depend on the species being studied and can be a standard code used for that species, a description, or both. as in: FV character
sex Sex of animal. M or F. Can enter unknown (U). as in: M character
comments Any comments deemed to have scientific relevance by the tagger. format: free text character
age_unit Units of age. as in: durif index character
holding_temperature This measure is the highest or lowest water bath temperature the fish will experience during holding (depends if surgical water temperatures are increasing or decreasing relative to initial water temperature reading). For example, if tagging is being cond units: degrees celsius; as in: 5ÂºC character
post_surgery_holding_period Time the animal is held after surgery until release. units: hours; as in: 2 character
pre_surgery_holding_period Time that animal is held prior to surgery. units: hours; as in: 0.5 character
dissolved_oxygen This measure is the lowest oxygen level the fish will experience during the surgery. format: free text; as in: 6 mg/l character
buffer_concentration_in_recirculation Concentration of buffer in recirculation bath. format: free text; as in: 0.1 ml/l character
anaesthetic_concentration_in_recirculation Concentration of anaesthetic in recirculation bath. format: free text; as in: 0.5 ml/l character
buffer_concentration_in_anaesthetic Concentration of buffer in anaesthetic. format: free text; as in: 0.1 ml/l character
anaesthetic_concentration Concentration of anaesthetic. format: free text; as in: 0.5 ml/l character
buffer Name of buffer used if applicable. as in: Sodium Bicarbonate character
anaesthetic Name of anaesthetic used if applicable. as in: Clove oil character
sedative_concentration Concentration of sedative. format: free text; as in: 0.5 ml/l character

Tags

Related function: get_tags().

field definition example data type
sensor_range Maximum range of sensor. as in: 34 character
sensor_intercept Raw value of intercept, as used for sensor calibration. format: double; as in: -0.6065 numeric
sensor_slope Raw value of slope, as used for sensor calibration. format: double; as in: 0.1516 numeric
sensor_type Type of tag sensor. Predefined options: P, T or A. P = pressure, T = temperature, A = acceleration. as in: P character
battery_estimated_end_date Estimated date at which tag will stop transmitting. Date fields should follow the ISO-8601 format. format: yyyy-mm-ddT; as in: 2017-06-27T datetime
battery_estimated_life Estimated duration of time during which the tag will be transmitting. units: days; as in: 90 character
activation_date datetime
status Current status of the tag. Three options: available, active or ended. as in: active character
tag_id_code In the case of an acoustic tag or Vemco mobile transceiver, this is the identification code transmitted by the tag, which is available from the tag manufacturer. as in: 1450 character
tag_id_protocol Tag code space of the detected tag. as in: S256 or A69-1105 character
serial_number Serial number assigned by tag manufacturer to uniquely identify tag. as in: 1036912 character
type Type of acoustic tag. Predefined options: animal, built-in, sentinel or range. as in: animal character
frequency Frequency at which the tag emits a signal. units: Hz; as in: 069k character
model Tag model number as provided by the manufacturer. as in: V9-6L character
manufacturer Name of tag manufacturer. Predefined options: VEMCO, CHELONIA or THELMA. as in: VEMCO character
telemetry_type Type of tag attached to animal. Some possible options are: acoustic, SAT, PSAT, PIT, DST, ADST, pDST as in: acoustic character
character
character
pk integer
step3_duration Duration of step 3. units: days; as in: 360 integer
step4_acceleration_duration Time window over which acceleration is sampled (in seconds). units: seconds, as in: 37 integer
step4_duration Duration of step 4. units: days; as in: 360 integer
step4_power Acoustic power level. H or L. as in: H character
step4_max_delay Maximum delay between the pings transmitted by the tag for step 4. units: seconds; as in: 60 character
step4_min_delay Minimum delay between the pings transmitted by the tag for step 4. units: seconds; as in: 30 character
step3_acceleration_duration Time window over which acceleration is sampled (in seconds). units: seconds, as in: 37 integer
step3_power Acoustic power level. H or L. as in: H character
step3_max_delay Maximum delay between the pings transmitted by the tag for step 3. units: seconds; as in: 60 character
step3_min_delay Minimum delay between the pings transmitted by the tag for step 3. units: seconds; as in: 30 character
step2_acceleration_duration Time window over which acceleration is sampled (in seconds). units: seconds, as in: 37 integer
step2_duration Duration of step 2. units: days; as in: 120 integer
step2_power Acoustic power level. H or L. as in: L character
step2_max_delay Maximum delay between the pings transmitted by the tag for step 2. units: seconds; as in: 60 character
step2_min_delay Minimum delay between the pings transmitted by the tag for step 2. units: seconds; as in: 30 character
step1_acceleration_duration Time window over which acceleration is sampled (in seconds). units: seconds, as in: 37 integer
step1_duration Duration of step 1. units: days; as in: 120 integer
step1_power Acoustic power level. H or L. as in: H character
step1_max_delay Maximum delay between the pings transmitted by the tag for step 1. units: seconds; as in: 60 character
step1_min_delay Minimum delay between the pings transmitted by the tag for step 1. units: seconds; as in: 30 character
financing_project Tag financing project. as in: project character
owner_pi First and last name of the Principal Investigator for the project. as in: Jan Reubens character
owner_organization Group owner of the tag. Use the exact group name to which the tag belongs. as in: VLIZ character
accelerometer_samples_per_second Number of acceleration samples taken on each axis per second. Sampling rate can be 5 Hertz (5 measurements/s) or 10 Hertz (10 measurements/s). units: Hertz; as in: 5 integer
accelerometer_algorithm There are two possible modes of operation of the accelerometer algorithm: Activity or Tailbeat. as in: Activity character
sensor_transmit_ratio Ratio of transmission between sensors present. If for example both a T and P sensor are present and T transmits twice as often as P, the range is 2 to 1. as in: 1 integer

Receivers

Related function: get_receivers().

field definition example data type
receiver_id The receiver name is composed of â€˜Model numberâ€™-â€˜Serial numberâ€™. as in: VR2W-120620 character
pk integer
ar_tilt_after_deploy Tilt after deploy of receiver format: integer; as in: 1003 character
ar_tilt_code Tilt code of the release. format: free text; as in: B character
ar_disable_code Code used to disable the release. format: free text; as in: H character
ar_release_code Code used to release the release; differs among release models. format: free text; as in: A; as in: 12345 character
ar_enable_code_address Code used to enable the release; differs among release models. format: free text; as in: G; as in: 68 character
ar_ping_rate Ping rate of the release. units: seconds; format: integer; as in: 1 character
ar_reply_frequency Frequency at which the release sends data. units: kHz; as in: 10 character
ar_receive_frequency Interrogate or receive frequency at which the release receives data. units: kHz; as in: 7.75 character
ar_interrogate_code Interrogate code or code range command of the release. Used to ping a specific release, rather than send a general ping to all releases in the vicinity. format: integer; as in: 1003 character
ar_voltage_at_deploy Voltage reported by an acoustic release as near as possible to the time of deployment. units: volt; format: double; as in: 12.2 character
ar_battery_estimated_life Expected duration for which the battery will provide adequate power for proper functioning of the acoustic release. units: months; format: integer; as in: 12 character
ar_serial_number Serial number of the acoustic release as provided by the manufacturer. as in: 48635 character
ar_model_number Model number of the acoustic release as provided by the manufacturer. as in: 867 character
built_in_tag_id Tag full ID of the receiverâ€™s built in tag. as in: A69-1601-60508 character
financing_project Receiver financing project. as in: project character
owner_organization Affiliation of the Principal Investigator for the project. as in: VLIZ character
battery_estimated_life Expected duration for which the battery will provide adequate power for proper functioning of the receiver. units: months; format: integer; as in: 12 character
status Current status of receiver. Predefined options: Active, Available, Broken, Lost or Returned to manufacturer. as in: Active or Lost character
modem_address This field is mandatory for Vemco VR4UWM receivers. It is a three-digit code from 001 to 249, as provided by the manufacturer, that is used to communicate with the Benthos modem. For VR4 receivers manufactured prior to September 2011, the modem address is format: 3-digit code from 001 to 249; as in 121 character
receiver_id_serial_number Serial number assigned by receiver manufacturer to uniquely identify receiver. as in: 106252 character
receiver_id_model Receiver model number as provided by the manufacturer. as in: VR2W character
manufacturer Name of receiver manufacturer. Predefined options: VEMCO, CHELONIA or THELMA. as in: Vemco character
unknown
application_type character

Deployments

Related function: get_deployments().

field definition example data type
time_drift Displayed difference in time between the instrumentâ€™s clock and correct UTC. Note: This must be recorded in the field for Vemco model VR3 receivers when there are no detections because no log file is created under those circumstances. format: hh:mm:ssZ; as in: 12:00:00Z character
pk integer
receiver_id Receiver ID linked to the deployment. Composed by â€˜Model numberâ€™-â€˜Serial numberâ€™. as in: VR2W-101578 character
application_type character
network_project_code character
station_name Name of the station where the deployment of the receiver takes place. Related to a specific latitude and longitude. format: free text; as in: OH6 character
station_description Name of receiver location. The location name serves as an additional descriptive name of the receiver station. It can refer to a specific nearby point of land, town, island, or body of water that identifies this receiver location. as in: upstream weir character
station_manager Name of the person or institution managing the location. as in: Jan Reubens character
deploy_date_time Date and time that the equipment was deployed, in 24-hour UTC. Corresponds to the time of the captured waypoint. Datetime fields should follow the ISO-8601 format (e.g.Â 2017-01-01T12:07:23Z) format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ; as in: 2017-06-27T12:00:00Z datetime
deploy_latitude Latitude of the actual deployment location, in decimal degrees. Note: in the southern hemisphere all latitudes must be negative. format: dd.ddddd; as in: 51.36324 double
deploy_longitude Longitude of the actual deployment location, in decimal degrees. Note: in the western hemisphere all longitudes must be negative. format: ddd.ddddd; as in: 2.59020 double
intended_latitude Latitude of the intended deployment location, in decimal degrees. Note: in the southern hemisphere all latitudes must be negative. format: dd.ddddd; as in: 51.36324 double
intended_longitude Longitude of the intended deployment location, in decimal degrees. Note: in the western hemisphere all longitudes must be negative. format: ddd.ddddd; as in: 2.59020 double
mooring_type Type of mooring to which the receiver is attached. Predefined options: surface-buoy, surface-wind-turbine or bottom-mooring. as in: surface-wind-turbine, surface-buoy or bottom-mooring character
bottom_depth Depth at deployment location as recorded by the vesselâ€™s depth sounder. units: metres; format: integer; as in: 25 character
riser_length Length from the anchor to the topmost float or structure of the mooring assembly. units: metres; format: integer; as in: 10 character
deploy_depth Depth of the instrument. units: metres; format: integer; as in: 20 character
battery_installation_date Date when the receiver was fitted with fresh batteries. format: yyyy-mm-dd; as in: 2017-06-27 datetime
battery_estimated_end_date Estimated date at which receiver will stop recording. This date is calculated automatically from (Deployments/Battery install date) and (Receivers/Expected battery life). format: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm; as in: 2017-06-04 00:00 datetime
activation_date_time Date and time the receiver was activated, in 24-hour UTC. format: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss; as in: 2017-08-08 12:00:00 datetime
recover_date_time Date and time that the equipment was recovered, in 24-hour UTC. ISO-8601 format (e.g.Â 2017-01-01T12:07:23Z). format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ; as in: 2017-06-27T12:00:00Z datetime
recover_latitude Latitude where the equipment was recovered, in decimal degrees. Unless it is found a substantial distance from its expected location, this can be left blank. For failed recovery attempts, use this field to record the central latitude of the recovery sea. format: dd.ddddd; as in: 51.36324 double
recover_longitude Longitude where the equipment was recovered, in decimal degrees. Unless it is found a substantial distance from its expected location, this can be left blank. For failed recovery attempts, use this field to record the central longitude of the recovery sea format: ddd.ddddd; as in: 2.59020 double
download_date_time Date and time that data were downloaded, in 24-hour UTC. format: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm; as in: 2017-06-27 12:00 datetime
download_file_name Were data downloaded? Yes or no. If no, please add comment. format: y or n; as in: y character
valid_data_until_date_time Date and time until which valid data was recorded, in 24-hour UTC. format: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss; as in: 2017-08-08 12:00:00 datetime
sync_date_time Date and time when a receiverâ€™s clock is synchronized to correct UTC, in 24-hour UTC. ISO-8601 format (e.g.Â 2017-01-01T12:07:23Z). format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ; as in: 2017-06-27T12:00:00Z datetime
ar_battery_installation_date Date when the acoustic release was fitted with fresh batteries, in 24-hour UTC format. format: yyyy-mm-dd; as in: 2017-06-27 datetime
ar_confirm Did the acoustic release report a confirmed release? Yes or no. format: y or n; as in: y character
transmit_profile Predefined options: Range test(random), Range test(90s) or Sync. as in: Sync character
transmit_power_output Predefined options: Low, Medium, High, Very high. as in: High character
log_temperature_stats_period Time interval between the recording of temperature statistic, as calculated from sample values. units: seconds; format: integer; as in: 3600 integer
log_temperature_sample_period Time interval between the sample values of temperature. This field is specific to VR2AR receivers. By default, sample values are not logged on the VR2AR receivers. units: seconds; format: integer; as in: 21600 integer
log_tilt_sample_period Time interval between the sample values of tilt. This field is specific to VR2AR receivers. units: seconds; format: integer; as in: 600 integer
log_noise_stats_period Time interval between the recording of noise statistic, as calculated from sample values. units: seconds; format: integer; as in: 600 integer
log_noise_sample_period Time interval between the sample values of noise. This field is specific to VR2AR receivers. By default, sample values are not logged on the VR2AR receivers. units: seconds; format: integer; as in: 600 integer
log_depth_stats_period Time interval between the recording of depth statistic, as calculated from sample values. units: seconds; format: integer; as in: 600 integer
log_depth_sample_period Time interval between the sample values of depth. This field is specific to VR2AR receivers. By default, sample values are not logged on the VR2AR receivers. units: seconds; format: integer; as in: 3600 integer
comments Any comments deemed to have scientific relevance by the tagger. format: free text character

Detections

Related function: get_detections().

field definition example data type
sensor_value_depth sensorValueDepthMeters double
sensor_value_acceleration SENSOR_VALUE_ACCELERATION as in: double
sensor_value_temperature double
signal_to_noise_ratio Signal-to-noise ratio. This is the difference between the background noise level and the signal level. Info comes from detection file. integer
source_file Name of the detection file. character
qc_flag Identifies whether there are quality check issues for the given detection. boolean
deployment_fk integer
pk Technical identifier of the detection record in the database. integer
date_time Date and time at which the tagged animal was detected at the receiver. Information from detection file. format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ; as in: 2017-06-27T12:00:00Z datetime
receiver_id Receiver name, composed of â€˜Model numberâ€™-â€˜Serial numberâ€™. Info comes from â€˜Detection_tableâ€™. as in: VR2W-103255 character
application_type character
network_project_code Code of the network project linked to this detection. character
tag_id Tag ID of the detected tag. As in: A69-1010-12345 character
tag_fk integer
animal_id integer
animal_project_code Code of the animal project linked to this detection. character
scientific_name Scientific name of the animal that carries the tag. as in: Anguilla anguilla or Gadus morhua character
station_name Name of receiver station. The station name refers to a unique location, related to a specific latitude and longitude. character
deploy_latitude double
deploy_longitude double
sensor_type character
sensor_value Value recorded by the tag sensor. as in: 35 or 0.13 double
sensor_unit Unit of measured sensor value. character
